answerText: Type Ia supernovae [prompt on Type I supernovae][10] The spectral lines of all type I supernovae are lacking in this element, the most abundant in the universe.
heading: ACF Regionals |2013 | UVA A + OSU A | 18 | Science | Physics | College
subject: Science
question: Question: The spectra of these features exhibits a silicon II line at 6150 angstroms, and their light curves feature a second peak twenty to thirty days after the initial peak. For 10 points each: [10] Name these features created by the runaway fusion of carbon and oxygen into iron.
